entry.title: ðŸ“˜ 30 Most Useful jQuery Snippets
DeadLock - Big Changes
entry.summary: Hi there ðŸ‘‹ First of all, I removed the fmt library from my project because of a simple reason- I didn't like the complexity that I had to introduce just to color the prompts in the terminal. Whether it be implementing its namespace, which I agree is very good and its way of formatting the string in the same way as python could help too, but the way it is implemented inside of the library can be made easier. And this is without addressing the other issue- configuring of CMake, even though I tried evverything written in their documentation, it just didn't work. If only it worked, my project would look so soo good, but sometimes you just have to part goodbye to some people to achieve good things in life. Speaking of goodbyes, last night I added the GitHub workflow for CMake as I thought it would help people looking to contribute in my project, but it had some other plans. I never worked with any GitHub workflow, so I thought why not use GitHub copilot for this task, but it still has a long way to go before it replaces me or any other programmer in the world. It first created the yml file with outdated packages, then after updating the packages, it removed the checking commands which were the whole point of running the workflow in the first place. After this too, it didn't stop as it was running in the agent mode, it went on for a whole hour before I manually deleted the file to remove the hassle altogether (Yeah, the commits are almost consecutively because I pushed them late to the Hub.) That's all for today, I will be back tomorrow with hopefully some good updates on this project. Thanks! ðŸ«¡

entry.title: When Universities Protect Themselves Over Indigenous Students: My Story at MRU
entry.summary:
After Facing Racism at MRU, Iâ€™m Demanding an Honorary Degree â€” and Public Accountability
When I enrolled at Mount Royal University, I expected to be judged by my work â€” not by my identity. Iâ€™m a neurodivergent Indigenous student who came in with ambition, skill, and a deep desire to build something real. What I didnâ€™t expect was to be humiliated, discredited, and ultimately gaslit by staff and administration who were more interested in protecting each other than upholding any standard of education or equity. Yasaman Amannejad, one of my instructors, deliberately withheld class information from me. This sabotage felt personal, not professional. I asked for clarity â€” she gave silence.
ðŸ‘‰ https://g.co/kgs/PtzeQXP
Mahsa, another instructor, refused to acknowledge my abilities until I â€œproâ€¦

entry.title: Smart Tracking: How AI Is Revolutionizing Marketing Analytics
entry.summary: Smart Tracking: How AI Is Revolutionizing Marketing Analytics This transformation represents more than just technological advancementâ€”it's a fundamental reimagining of how businesses understand, predict, and respond to customer behavior. From predictive customer analytics to real-time sentiment tracking, AI has become the invisible engine powering marketing success across industries. Traditional marketing analytics relied heavily on retrospective reporting and manual data interpretation. Marketers would spend weeks compiling reports from multiple sources, often discovering trends long after they could act on them. This reactive approach left businesses constantly playing catch-up with market dynamics and customer preferences. The introduction of AI has fundamentally changed this paradigm. â€¦

entry.title: Cloud-Based Monitoring and Control of Robotic Cleaners
entry.summary: In an era where smart homes and automated services are rapidly evolving, robotic cleaners are becoming an integral part of modern housekeeping. But while the hardware advancements are impressive, the real innovation lies in the way these robots are monitored and controlledâ€”especially through cloud platforms. This article delves into how cloud computing enables scalable, efficient, and intelligent management of cleaning robots, making them more autonomous and easier to manage from anywhere in the world. We'll cover key technologies, potential applications, and even include code snippets to demonstrate practical implementation. Robotic cleaners are increasingly deployed in both residential and commercial environments. As fleets grow, so does the complexity of their maintenance and control. Câ€¦

entry.title: Scheduling Jobs With Quartz and Database Persistence With EF Core Migrations
entry.summary: There are multiple options for job scheduling in .NET. The simplest one is creating a Background Service in ASP.NET Core with a static Periodic Timer. But if you need more customization options and job persistence, you need a library. My personal favourite is Quartz.NET. It's a fully-featured, open-source job scheduling system that can be used from the smallest apps to large-scale enterprise systems. In this post, I will show you: How to add Quartz.NET to your ASP.NET Core application How to schedule jobs with different trigger types How to dynamically create jobs and triggers How to use Quartz.NET with database persistence using EF Core migrations Let's dive in. On my website: antondevtips.com I share .NET and Architecture best practices. Subscribe to my newsletter to improve yourÂ .NET skâ€¦

entry.title: Do you know a Odyssey.world?
entry.summary: Odyssey strikes me as a highly interesting project, particularly for its attempt to craft interactive video experiences using AI. Despite being in its infancy, I'm quite hopeful for its success. The ability to generate snapshots every 40ms in response to user actions is remarkable and, in my opinion, points to a significant future for this technologyâ€”perhaps even leading to a new generation of video games. It's already capable of generating video at up to 30 FPS. While the current demo reveals some blurriness and instability in the environments, the company has indicated that rapid advancements are on the horizon, including more precise modeling of world dynamics. Try current demo

entry.title: My Web Development Journey: How I Got Started
entry.summary: Like many people, my journey into web development didnâ€™t begin with a computer science degree or a tech job. It started with curiosityâ€”and a lot of Google searches. Iâ€™ve always been fascinated by how things work. Whenever I visited websites, Iâ€™d often wonder, â€œHow do these buttons know where to go?â€ or â€œHow does this page look so good?â€ For a long time, I thought only professionals or computer geniuses could build websites. But one day, while browsing YouTube, I stumbled across a video titled â€œHow to Build a Website Using HTML and CSS.â€ That one video completely changed my direction. At first, I was just playing around. I didnâ€™t know what HTML or CSS stood forâ€”I just followed along. I opened Notepad, wrote some lines, saved the file as .html, and opened it in a browser. When I saw my name â€¦

entry.title: ðŸ” Understanding ===, Logical Operators, and Post-Increment (++) in Programming
entry.summary:
Great! You're exploring some important programming concepts like comparison operators (===), logical operators (and, or), and post-increment (usercore++). Iâ€™ll help you write a simple blog post that introduces these topics in a beginner-friendly way. ===, Logical Operators, and Post-Increment (++) in Programming
If you're new to programming, understanding operators is one of the first steps toward writing powerful, logical code. In this blog post, we'll explore some fundamental concepts: The === operator Logical operators like and and or
The post-increment operator (++) Letâ€™s break them down with simple examples. ===?
The === operator is strict equality in many languages like JavaScript. It checks both value and type. 5 === 5 // true (same value, same type) '5' === 5 // faâ€¦
